title: Authorizes school districts to purchase curriculum and instructional resources with money that has otherwise been set aside for the purchase of textbooks
summary: Authorizes school districts to purchase curriculum and instructional resources with money that has otherwise been set aside for the purchase of textbooks.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1579

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 10, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  OPPENHEIMER -- read twice and ordered printed, and
         when printed to be committed to the Committee on Education

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to allowing the  purchase
         of  curriculum  and  instructional  resources with money set aside for
         textbooks

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 701 of the education law, as amended by chapter 587
    2  of  the laws of 1973, subdivision 2 as amended by section 8 of part L of
    3  chapter 405 of the laws of 1999, subdivision 3 as amended by chapter 391
    4  of the laws of 1989, subdivision 4 as amended by chapter 82 of the  laws
    5  of  1995,  subdivision 6 as amended by section 6 of part B of chapter 57
    6  of the laws of 2007, subdivision 7 as amended by section 2 of part A  of
    7  chapter  436  of  the laws of 1997 and subdivision 8 as added by chapter
    8  635 of the laws of 1984, is amended to read as follows:
    9    S 701. Power to designate text-books; purchase and loan of text-books;
   10  purchase of supplies. 1. In the several cities and school  districts  of
   11  the  state,  boards  of  education,  trustees or such body or officer as
   12  perform the functions of such boards,  shall  designate  text-books  AND
   13  CURRICULUM  AND  INSTRUCTIONAL RESOURCES to be used in the schools under
   14  their charge.
   15    2. (A) A text-book, for the purposes of this section shall  mean:  (i)
   16  any  book,  or  a  book  substitute, which shall include hard covered or
   17  paperback books, work books, or manuals and (ii) for  expenses  incurred
   18  after  July first, nineteen hundred ninety-nine, any courseware or other
   19  content-based instructional materials in an electronic format,  as  such
   20  terms  are defined in the regulations of the commissioner, which a pupil
   21  is required to use as a text, or  a  text-substitute,  in  a  particular
   22  class or program in the school he or she legally attends.
   23    (B)  CURRICULUM  AND  INSTRUCTIONAL RESOURCES FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS
   24  SECTION, SHALL MEAN INQUIRY-CENTERED CURRICULUM AND INSTRUCTIONAL  MATE-

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05311-01-1

       S. 1579                             2

    1  RIALS,  SUPPLIES,  MANIPULATIVES,  OR  OTHER RESOURCES WHICH ARE ALIGNED
    2  WITH STATE STANDARDS USED  BY  STUDENTS  AND  TEACHERS  TO  SUPPORT  AND
    3  ENHANCE TEACHING AND LEARNING.
    4    (C)  Expenditures aided pursuant to this section shall not be eligible
    5  for aid pursuant to  section  seven  hundred  eleven  or  seven  hundred
    6  fifty-one  of  this [chapter] TITLE.   Courseware or other content-based
    7  instructional materials in an electronic format included  in  the  defi-
    8  nition  of textbook pursuant to this subdivision shall be subject to the
    9  same limitations on content as apply to books or book substitutes  aided
   10  pursuant to this section.
   11    3.  In the several cities and school districts of the state, boards of
   12  education, trustees or such body or officers as perform the function  of
   13  such  boards  shall have the power and duty to: (A) purchase and to loan
   14  upon individual request, textbooks, to all  children  residing  in  such
   15  district  who are enrolled in a public school including children attend-
   16  ing the public schools of the district for whom the district is eligible
   17  to receive reimbursement pursuant to [paragraph a of] subdivision  eight
   18  of  section  thirty-two  hundred two of this chapter, provided, however,
   19  that such children shall not be counted by any  other  school  district,
   20  and  to  all  children  residing  in such district who are enrolled in a
   21  nonpublic school; AND (B) PURCHASE AND TO LOAN UPON INDIVIDUAL  REQUEST,
   22  CURRICULUM AND INSTRUCTIONAL MATERIALS, TO ALL CHILDREN RESIDING IN SUCH
   23  DISTRICT  WHO ARE ENROLLED IN A PUBLIC SCHOOL INCLUDING CHILDREN ATTEND-
   24  ING THE PUBLIC SCHOOLS OF THE DISTRICT FOR WHOM THE DISTRICT IS ELIGIBLE
   25  TO RECEIVE REIMBURSEMENT PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION EIGHT OF SECTION  THIR-
   26  TY-TWO  HUNDRED  TWO OF THIS CHAPTER, PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT SUCH CHIL-
   27  DREN SHALL NOT BE COUNTED BY ANY OTHER SCHOOL DISTRICT, AND TO ALL CHIL-
   28  DREN RESIDING IN SUCH DISTRICT WHO ARE ENROLLED IN A  NONPUBLIC  SCHOOL.
   29  Textbooks  AND CURRICULUM AND INSTRUCTIONAL RESOURCES loaned to children
   30  enrolled in said nonpublic schools shall be textbooks AND CURRICULUM AND
   31  INSTRUCTIONAL RESOURCES which are  designated  for  use  in  any  public
   32  schools  of  the state or are approved by any boards of education, trus-
   33  tees or other school authorities.  Such  textbooks  AND  CURRICULUM  AND
   34  INSTRUCTIONAL  RESOURCES  are to be loaned free to such children subject
   35  to such rules and regulations as are or may be prescribed by  the  board
   36  of  regents  and  such  boards  of  education,  trustees or other school
   37  authorities. Enrollment shall  be  as  defined  in  subdivision  one  of
   38  section thirty-six hundred two of this chapter.
   39    4.  No  school  district  shall  be  required to purchase or otherwise
   40  acquire textbooks OR CURRICULUM AND INSTRUCTIONAL RESOURCES, the cost of
   41  which shall exceed an amount equal  to  the  apportionment  pursuant  to
   42  subdivision  six of this section plus a minimum lottery grant determined
   43  pursuant to subdivision  four  of  section  ninety-two-c  of  the  state
   44  finance  law  multiplied  by  the  number  of  children residing in such
   45  district and so enrolled in the base year; and no school district  shall
   46  be  required to loan textbooks OR CURRICULUM AND INSTRUCTIONAL RESOURCES
   47  in excess of the textbooks OR  CURRICULUM  AND  INSTRUCTIONAL  RESOURCES
   48  owned or acquired by such district; provided, however that all textbooks
   49  OR  CURRICULUM  AND  INSTRUCTIONAL  RESOURCES  owned or acquired by such
   50  district shall be loaned to children residing in  the  district  and  so
   51  enrolled in public and nonpublic schools on an equitable basis.
   52    5.  In the several cities and school districts of the state, boards of
   53  education, trustees or other school authorities  may  purchase  supplies
   54  and  either  rent,  sell  or  loan  the same to the pupils attending the
   55  public schools in such cities and school districts upon such  terms  and

       S. 1579                             3

    1  under  such rules and regulations as may be prescribed by such boards of
    2  education, trustees or other school authorities.
    3    6. The commissioner, in addition to the annual apportionment of public
    4  monies  pursuant  to  other articles of this chapter, shall apportion to
    5  each school district an amount equal to the cost of  the  textbooks  AND
    6  CURRICULUM  AND  INSTRUCTIONAL  RESOURCES  purchased  and  loaned by the
    7  district pursuant to this section in the base year, but in no case shall
    8  the aid apportioned to the district exceed the product of  the  textbook
    9  factor  plus a minimum lottery grant, determined pursuant to subdivision
   10  four of section ninety-two-c of the state finance law, and  the  sum  of
   11  the  enrollments  in grades kindergarten through twelve in the base year
   12  calculated pursuant to subparagraphs four, five, and six of paragraph  n
   13  of  subdivision  one  of section thirty-six hundred two of this chapter.
   14  Aid payable pursuant to this section  shall  be  deemed  final  and  not
   15  subject  to  change  after  April thirtieth of the school year for which
   16  payment was due.
   17    For aid payable in the two thousand seven--two thousand  eight  school
   18  year and thereafter, the textbook factor shall equal forty-three dollars
   19  and twenty-five cents.
   20    7.  The  apportionment  provided for in this section shall be paid, at
   21  such times as may be determined by the commissioner and approved by  the
   22  director of the budget, during the school year in which the expenditures
   23  are reported to the department prior to such apportionment. Expenditures
   24  by  a  school  district  in excess of the product of the textbook factor
   25  plus a minimum lottery grant determined pursuant to subdivision four  of
   26  section ninety-two-c of the state finance law and the sum of the enroll-
   27  ments  in grades kindergarten through twelve in the base year calculated
   28  pursuant to subparagraphs four, five, and six of paragraph n of subdivi-
   29  sion one of section thirty-six hundred two of this chapter in any school
   30  year shall be deemed approved operating expense of the district for  the
   31  purpose  of  computation  of  state  aid  pursuant to section thirty-six
   32  hundred two of this chapter, but expenditures up to such  product  shall
   33  not be deemed approved operating expenses for such purpose.
   34    8. In its discretion, a board of education may adopt regulations spec-
   35  ifying the date by which requests for the purchase and loan of textbooks
   36  AND  CURRICULUM  AND  INSTRUCTIONAL  RESOURCES  must  be received by the
   37  district. Notice of such date shall be given to all non-public  schools.
   38  Such  date shall not be earlier than the first day of June of the school
   39  year prior to that for which such textbooks AND CURRICULUM AND  INSTRUC-
   40  TIONAL  RESOURCES  are being requested, provided, however, that a parent
   41  or guardian of a child not  attending  a  particular  non-public  school
   42  prior  to June first of the school year may submit a written request for
   43  textbooks AND/OR CURRICULUM AND INSTRUCTIONAL  RESOURCES  within  thirty
   44  days after such child is enrolled in such non-public school. In no event
   45  however  shall  a  request  made later than the times otherwise provided
   46  pursuant to this subdivision be denied where a reasonable explanation is
   47  given for the delay in making the request.
   48    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to allowing the purchase of curriculum and instructional resources with money set aside for textbooks
